maacah_1839.name: Maacah
maacah_1839.bio: A daughter of Talmai, king of the old native population of Geshur. She became one of David’s wives, and was the mother of Absalom ([2 Sam. 3:3](/2sam#2Sam.3.3)).

maachah_1841.name: Maachah (Queen of Israel)
maachah_1841.bio: The daughter of Abishalom (called Absalom, [2 Chr. 11:20-22](/2chr#2Chr.11.20)), the third wife of Rehoboam, and mother of Abijam ([1 Kings 15:2](/1kgs#1Kgs.15.2)). She is called “Michaiah the daughter of Uriel,” who was the husband of Absalom’s daughter Tamar ([2 Chr.

maachah_1845.name: Maachah (father of Hanan)
maachah_1845.bio: The father of Hanan, who was one of David’s body-guard ([1 Chr. 11:43](/1chr#1Chr.11.43)).

maachah_1934.name: Maachah (Son of Nahor)
maachah_1934.bio: The father of Achish, the king of Gath ([1 Kings 2:39](/1kgs#1Kgs.2.39)), called also Maoch ([1 Sam. 27:2](/1sam#1Sam.27.2)).

maaseiah_1849.name: Maaseiah (A Levite musician)
maaseiah_1849.bio: One of the Levites whom David appointed as porter for the ark ([1 Chr. 15:18](/1chr#1Chr.15.18), [20](/1chr#1Chr.15.20)).

maaseiah_1850.name: Maaseiah (Father of Maaseiah)
maaseiah_1850.bio: One of the “captains of hundreds” associated with Jehoiada in restoring king Jehoash to the throne ([2 Chr. 23:1](/2chr#2Chr.23.1)).

maaseiah_1852.name: Maaseiah (Son of Ahaz. killed by Zichri)

maaseiah_1853.name: Maaseiah (Governor of Jerusalem in the reign of Jo)
maaseiah_1853.bio: One who was sent by king Josiah to repair the temple ([2 Chr. 34:8](/2chr#2Chr.34.8)). He was governor (Heb.

maaseiah_1854.name: Maaseiah (the priest who divorced his wife)

maaseiah_1856.name: Maaseiah (priest who had married foreign wife)

maaseiah_1857.name: Maaseiah ('s father was Pahath-Moab.  He had 7 bro)

maaseiah_1866.name: Maaseiah (one of the commanders)
maaseiah_1866.bio: The father of the priest Zephaniah ([Jer. 21:1](/jer#Jer.21.1); [37:3](/jer#Jer.37.3)).

maasiai_1870.name: Maasiai
maasiai_1870.bio: Work of Jehovah, one of the priests resident at Jerusalem at the Captivity ([1 Chr. 9:12](/1chr#1Chr.9.12)).

maath_1871.name: Maath
maath_1871.bio: Small, a person named in our Lord’s ancestry ([Luke 3:26](/luke#Luke.3.26)).

maaziah_1873.name: Maaziah
maaziah_1873.bio: The head of the twenty-fourth priestly course ([1 Chr. 24:18](/1chr#1Chr.24.18)) in David’s reign.

machir_1877.name: Machir (son of Manasseh)
machir_1877.bio: Manasseh’s oldest son ([Josh. 17:1](/josh#Josh.17.1)), or probably his only son (see [1 Chr. 7:14](/1chr#1Chr.7.14), [15](/1chr#1Chr.7.15); comp.

machir_1878.name: Machir (Lo-debar)
machir_1878.bio: A descendant of the preceding, residing at Lo-debar, where he maintained Jonathan’s son Mephibosheth till he was taken under the care of David ([2 Sam. 9:4](/2sam#2Sam.9.4)), and where he afterwards gave shelter to David himself when he was a fugitive (17:27).

madai_1880.name: Madai
madai_1880.bio: Middle land, the third “son” of Japheth ([Gen. 10:2](/gen#Gen.10.2)), the name by which the Medes are known on the Assyrian monuments.

magog_1882.name: Magog
magog_1882.bio: Region of Gog, the second of the “sons” of Japheth ([Gen. 10:2](/gen#Gen.10.2); [1 Chr. 1:5](/1chr#1Chr.1.5)).

mahalaleel_1885.name: Mahalaleel (the Patriarch)
mahalaleel_1885.bio: The son of Cainan, of the line of Seth ([Gen. 5:12-17](/gen#Gen.5.12)); called Maleleel ([Luke 3:37](/luke#Luke.3.37)).

mahalath_1888.name: Mahalath
mahalath_1888.bio: The daughter of Jerimoth, who was one of David’s sons. She was one of Rehoboam’s wives ([2 Chr. 11:18](/2chr#2Chr.11.18)).

mahath_150.name: Mahath (son of Amasai)
mahath_150.bio: A Kohathite Levite, father of Elkanah ([1 Chr. 6:35](/1chr#1Chr.6.35)).

mahath_1891.name: Mahath (the Kohathite)
mahath_1891.bio: Another Kohathite Levite, of the time of Hezekiah ([2 Chr. 29:12](/2chr#2Chr.29.12)).

mahazioth_1893.name: Mahazioth
mahazioth_1893.bio: Visions, a Kohathite Levite, chief of the twenty-third course of musicians ([1 Chr. 25:4](/1chr#1Chr.25.4), [30](/1chr#1Chr.25.30)).

mahlah_1895.name: Mahlah
mahlah_1895.bio: Disease, one of the five daughters of Zelophehad ([Num. 27:1-11](/num#Num.27.1)) who had their father’s inheritance, the law of inheritance having been altered in their favour.

mahli_1896.name: Mahli (Bon of Mushi and grandson of Merari)

mahlon_1897.name: Mahlon
mahlon_1897.bio: Sickly, the elder of Elimelech the Bethlehemite’s two sons by Naomi. He married Ruth and died childless ([Ruth 1:2](/ruth#Ruth.1.2), [5](/ruth#Ruth.1.5); 4:9, 10), in the land of Moab.

mahol_1898.name: Mahol
mahol_1898.bio: Dance, the father of four sons ([1 Kings 4:31](/1kgs#1Kgs.4.31)) who were inferior in wisdom only to Solomon.

malachi_1899.name: Malachi
malachi_1899.bio: Messenger or angel, the last of the minor prophets, and the writer of the last book of the Old Testament canon ([Mal. 4:4](/mal#Mal.4.4), [5](/mal#Mal.4.5), [6](/mal#Mal.4.6)). Nothing is known of him beyond what is contained in his book of prophecies.

malchi-shua_1990.name: Malchi-shua
malchi-shua_1990.bio: King of help, one of the four sons of Saul ([1 Chr. 8:33](/1chr#1Chr.8.33)). He perished along with his father in the battle of Gilboa ([1 Sam.

malchiah_1906.name: Malchiah (Harim)
malchiah_1906.bio: A priest who stood by Ezra when he “read in the book of the law of God” ([Neh. 8:4](/neh#Neh.8.4)).

malchijah_1909.name: Malchijah (The first Malchijah mentioned in the Bib)

malchijah_1910.name: Malchijah (A descendant of Levi through Gershon and)
malchijah_1910.bio: The head of the fifth division of the priests in the time of David ([1 Chr. 24:9](/1chr#1Chr.24.9)).

malchijah_1912.name: Malchijah (A descendant of Levi through Gershon and)

malchijah_1914.name: Malchijah (part of the choir)
malchijah_1914.bio: One of the priests appointed as musicians to celebrate the completion of the walls of Jerusalem ([Neh. 12:42](/neh#Neh.12.42)).

malchus_1916.name: Malchus
malchus_1916.bio: Reigning, the personal servant or slave of the high priest Caiaphas. He is mentioned only by John. Peter cut off his right ear in the garden of Gethsemane ([John 18:10](/john#John.18.10)).

mallothi_1917.name: Mallothi
mallothi_1917.bio: My fulness, a Kohathite Levite, one of the sons of Heman the Levite ([1 Chr. 25:4](/1chr#1Chr.25.4)), and chief of the nineteenth division of the temple musicians (26).

malluch_1918.name: Malluch (Of the Tribe of Levi)
malluch_1918.bio: A Levite of the family of Merari ([1 Chr. 6:44](/1chr#1Chr.6.44)).

malluch_1921.name: Malluch (the priest)
malluch_1921.bio: A priest who returned from Babylon ([Neh. 12:2](/neh#Neh.12.2)).

malluch_1922.name: Malluch (A Levite of the family of Merari - A pri)

mamre_1923.name: Mamre
mamre_1923.bio: An Amoritish chief in alliance with Abraham ([Gen. 14:13](/gen#Gen.14.13), [24](/gen#Gen.14.24)).

manaen_1926.name: Manaen
manaen_1926.bio: consoler, a Christian teacher at Antioch. Nothing else is known of him beyond what is stated in Acts 13:1 , where he is spoken of as having been brought up with (Gr. syntrophos; rendered in RSV "foster brother" of) Herod, i.e., Herod Antipas, the tetrach, who, with his brother Archelaus, was educated at Rome.

manasseh_1928.name: Manasseh (sons born to you in Egypt)
manasseh_1928.bio: The elder of the two sons of Joseph. He and his brother Ephraim were afterwards adopted by Jacob as his own sons (48:1). There is an account of his marriage to a Syrian ([1 Chr.

manasseh_1930.name: Manasseh (Son of Joseph)
manasseh_1930.bio: The elder of the two sons of Joseph. He and his brother Ephraim were afterwards adopted by Jacob as his own sons (48:1). There is an account of his marriage to a Syrian ([1 Chr.

manasseh_1931.name: Manasseh (who was given to Joseph as a gift from t)

manoah_1933.name: Manoah
manoah_1933.bio: Rest, a Danite, the father of Samson ([Judg. 13:1-22](/judg#Judg.13.1), and 14:2-4).

mark_1679.name: John (the apostle)
mark_1679.bio: The Hebrew name of Mark (q.v.). He is designated by this name in the acts of the Apostles ( Acts 12:12 Acts 12:25 ; Acts 13:5 Acts 13:13 ; 15:37 ).

martha_1937.name: Martha
martha_1937.bio: Bitterness, the sister of Lazarus and Mary, and probably the eldest of the family, who all resided at Bethany ([Luke 10:38](/luke#Luke.10.38), [40](/luke#Luke.10.40), [41](/luke#Luke.10.41); [John 11:1-39](/john#John.11.1)). From the residence being called “her house,” some have supposed that she was a widow, and that her brother and sister lodged with her. She seems to have been of an anxious, bustling spirit, anxious to be helpful in providing the best things for the Master’s use, in contrast to the quiet earnestness of Mary, who was more concerned to avail herself of the opportunity of sitting at his feet and learning of him.

mary_1938.name: Mary (The wife of Joseph)
mary_1938.bio: Hebrew Miriam. The wife of Joseph, the mother of Jesus, called the "Virgin Mary," though never so designated in Scripture ( Matthew 2:11 ; Acts 1:14 ). Little is known of her personal history.

mary_1939.name: Mary (a first-century BC Galilean Jewish woman)
mary_1939.bio: Mary the sister of Lazarus is brought to our notice in connection with the visits of our Lord to Bethany. She is contrasted with her sister Martha, who was “cumbered about many things” while Jesus was their guest, while Mary had chosen “the good part.” Her character also appears in connection with the death of her brother ([John 11:20](/john#John.11.20), [31](/john#John.11.31), [33](/john#John.11.33)). On the occasion of our Lord’s last visit to Bethany, Mary brought “a pound of ointment of spikenard, very costly, and anointed the feet of Jesus” as he reclined at table in the house of one Simon, who had been a leper ([Matt.

mary_1941.name: Mary (the mother of John)
mary_1941.bio: Hebrew Miriam. Mary the mother of John Mark was one of the earliest of our Lord's disciples. She was the sister of Barnabas ( Colossians 4:10 ), and joined with him in disposing of their land and giving the proceeds of the sale into the treasury of the Church ( Acts 4:37 ; 12:12 ).

mary_1942.name: Mary (the mother of James)
mary_1942.bio: A Christian at Rome who treated Paul with special kindness ([Rom. 16:6](/rom#Rom.16.6)).

mary_1943.name: Mary (mother of Jesus Christ)
mary_1943.bio: A surname derived from Magdala, the place of her nativity, given to one of the Marys of the Gospels to distinguish her from the other Marys ([Matt. 27:56](/matt#Matt.27.56), [61](/matt#Matt.27.61); 28:1, etc.). A mistaken notion has prevailed that this Mary was a woman of bad character, that she was the woman who is emphatically called “a sinner” ([Luke 7:36-50](/luke#Luke.7.36)).

mash_1944.name: Mash
mash_1944.bio: (= Meshech [1 Chr. 1:17](/1chr#1Chr.1.17)), one of the four sons of Aram, and the name of a tribe descended from him ([Gen. 10:23](/gen#Gen.10.23)) inhabiting some part probably of Mesopotamia.

massa_1945.name: Massa
massa_1945.bio: A lifting up, gift, one of the sons of Ishmael, the founder of an Arabian tribe ([Gen. 25:14](/gen#Gen.25.14)); a nomad tribe inhabiting the Arabian desert toward Babylonia.

mattan_1948.name: Mattan (the priest of Baal)
mattan_1948.bio: A priest of Baal, slain before his altar during the reformation under Jehoiada ([2 Kings 11:18](/2kgs#2Kgs.11.18)).

mattaniah_1952.name: Mattaniah (A Levite who assisted in purifying the t)
mattaniah_1952.bio: A Levite, son of Heman, the chief of the ninth class of temple singers ([1 Chr. 25:4](/1chr#1Chr.25.4), [16](/1chr#1Chr.25.16)).

mattaniah_1954.name: Mattaniah (son of Asaph)
mattaniah_1954.bio: A Levite who assisted in purifying the temple at the reformation under Hezekiah ([2 Chr. 29:13](/2chr#2Chr.29.13)).

mattathias_1963.name: Mattathias (An ancestor of Jesus)
mattathias_1963.bio: The son of Amos, in the genealogy of our Lord ([Luke 3:25](/luke#Luke.3.25)).

mattathias_1964.name: Mattathias (eldest son of Shallum)
mattathias_1964.bio: The son of Semei, in the same genealogy ([Luke 3:26](/luke#Luke.3.26)).

matthan_1968.name: Matthan
matthan_1968.bio: The son of Eleazar, and father of Jacob, who was the father of Joseph, the husband of the Virgin Mary ([Matt. 1:15](/matt#Matt.1.15)).

matthat_1969.name: Matthat (the son of Matthat)
matthat_1969.bio: The son of Levi, and father of Heli ([Luke 3:24](/luke#Luke.3.24)).

matthew_1971.name: Matthew
matthew_1971.bio: gift of God, a common Jewish name after the Exile. He was the son of Alphaeus, and was a publican or tax-gatherer at Capernaum. On one occasion Jesus, coming up from the side of the lake, passed the custom-house where Matthew was seated, and said to him, "Follow me." Matthew arose and followed him, and became his disciple ( Matthew 9:9 ).

mattithiah_1973.name: Mattithiah (son of Jeduthun)
mattithiah_1973.bio: The eldest son of Shallum, of the family of Korah ([1 Chr. 9:31](/1chr#1Chr.9.31)).

mattithiah_1974.name: Mattithiah (one of the harpists to praise god)
mattithiah_1974.bio: One of the sons of Jeduthun ([1 Chr. 25:3](/1chr#1Chr.25.3), [21](/1chr#1Chr.25.21)).

mattithiah_1976.name: Mattithiah (One of the Leaders)
mattithiah_1976.bio: One who stood by Ezra while reading the law ([Neh. 8:4](/neh#Neh.8.4)).

medan_1978.name: Medan
medan_1978.bio: A son of Jokshan, Abraham’s son by Keturah ([1 Chr. 1:32](/1chr#1Chr.1.32)). His descendants settled on the Syrian borders about the territory of Edom.

mehetabeel_1979.name: Mehetabeel
mehetabeel_1979.bio: Whose benefactor is God, the father of Delaiah, and grandfather of Shemaiah, who joined Sanballat against Nehemiah ([Neh. 6:10](/neh#Neh.6.10)).

mehetabel_1980.name: Mehetabel
mehetabel_1980.bio: Wife of Hadad, one of the kings of Edom ([Gen. 36:39](/gen#Gen.36.39)).

mehujael_1983.name: Mehujael
mehujael_1983.bio: Smitten by God, the son of Irad, and father of Methusael ([Gen. 4:18](/gen#Gen.4.18)).

mehuman_1984.name: Mehuman
mehuman_1984.bio: Faithful, one of the eunchs whom Ahasuerus (Xerxes) commanded to bring in Vashti ([Esther 1:10](/esth#Esth.1.10)).

melchi_1988.name: Melchi (Melki the son of Addi)
melchi_1988.bio: The son of Addi, and father of Neri ([Luke 3:28](/luke#Luke.3.28)).

melchisedec_1991.name: Melchisedec
melchisedec_1991.bio: King of righteousness, the king of Salem (q.v.). All we know of him is recorded in [Gen. 14:18-20](/gen#Gen.14.18).

melea_1992.name: Melea
melea_1992.bio: Fulness, the son of Menan and father of Eliakim, in the genealogy of our Lord ([Luke 3:31](/luke#Luke.3.31)).

melech_1993.name: Melech
melech_1993.bio: King, the second of Micah’s four sons ([1 Chr. 8:35](/1chr#1Chr.8.35)), and thus grandson of Mephibosheth.

melzar_1994.name: Melzar
melzar_1994.bio: Probably a Persian word meaning master of wine, i.e., chief butler; the title of an officer at the Babylonian court ([Dan. 1:11](/dan#Dan.1.11), [16](/dan#Dan.1.16)) who had charge of the diet of the Hebrew youths.

memucan_1995.name: Memucan
memucan_1995.bio: Dignified, one of the royal counsellors at the court of Ahasuerus, by whose suggestion Vashti was divorced ([Esther 1:14](/esth#Esth.1.14), [16](/esth#Esth.1.16), [21](/esth#Esth.1.21)).

menahem_1996.name: Menahem
menahem_1996.bio: Conforting, the son of Gadi, and successor of Shallum, king of Israel, whom he slew. After a reign of about ten years (B.C. 771-760) he died, leaving the throne to his son Pekahiah.

mephibosheth_1999.name: Mephibosheth (lame son of Jonathan)
mephibosheth_1999.bio: The son of Jonathan, and grandson of Saul ([2 Sam. 4:4](/2sam#2Sam.4.4)). He was but five years old when his father and grandfather fell on Mount Gilboa.

mephibosheth_2000.name: Mephibosheth (son of Saul by Rizpah)
mephibosheth_2000.bio: The name of Saul’s son by the concubine Rizpah (q.v.), the daughter of Aiah. He and his brother Armoni were with five others “hanged on a hill before the Lord” by the Gibeonites, and their bodies exposed in the sun for five months ([2 Sam. 21:8-10](/2sam#2Sam.21.8)).

merab_2001.name: Merab
merab_2001.bio: Increase, the eldest of Saul’s two daughters ([1 Sam. 14:49](/1sam#1Sam.14.49)). She was betrothed to David after his victory over Goliath, but does not seem to have entered heartily into this arrangement (18:2, 17, 19).

meraiah_2002.name: Meraiah
meraiah_2002.bio: Resistance, a chief priest, a contemporary of the high priest Joiakim ([Neh. 12:12](/neh#Neh.12.12)).

meraioth_2003.name: Meraioth
meraioth_2003.bio: Father of Amariah, a high priest of the line of Eleazar ([1 Chr. 6:6](/1chr#1Chr.6.6), [7](/1chr#1Chr.6.7), [52](/1chr#1Chr.6.52)).

merari_2004.name: Merari
merari_2004.bio: Sad; bitter, the youngest son of Levi, born before the descent of Jacob into Egypt, and one of the seventy who accompanied him thither ([Gen. 46:11](/gen#Gen.46.11); [Ex. 6:16](/exod#Exod.6.16)).

mered_2005.name: Mered
mered_2005.bio: Rebellion, one of the sons of Ezra, of the tribe of Judah ([1 Chr. 4:17](/1chr#1Chr.4.17)).

meremoth_2006.name: Meremoth (of Jerusalem´s Wall Restoration)
meremoth_2006.bio: Exaltations, heights, a priest who returned from Babylon with Zerubbabel ([Neh. 12:3](/neh#Neh.12.3)), to whom were sent the sacred vessels ([Ezra 8:33](/ezra#Ezra.8.33)) belonging to the temple. He took part in rebuilding the walls of Jerusalem ([Neh.

merodach-baladan_483.name: Merodach-baladan
merodach-baladan_483.bio: Merodach has given a son, ([Isa. 39:1](/isa#Isa.39.1)), “the hereditary chief of the Chaldeans, a small tribe at that time settled in the marshes at the mouth of the Euphrates, but in consequence of his conquest of Babylon afterwards, they became the dominant caste in Babylonia itself.” One bearing this name sent ambassadors to Hezekiah (B.C. 721).

mesha_2009.name: Mesha (King of Moab)
mesha_2009.bio: Heb. id, a king of Moab, the son of Chemosh-Gad, a man of great wealth in flocks and herds ([2 Kings 3:4](/2kgs#2Kgs.3.4)). After the death of Ahab at Ramoth-Gilead, Mesha shook off the yoke of Israel; but on the ascension of Jehoram to the throne of Israel, that king sought the help of Jehoshaphat in an attempt to reduce the Moabites again to their former condition.

mesha_2010.name: Mesha (A Benjamite)
mesha_2010.bio: Heb. meysh’a, “deliverance,” the eldest son of Caleb ([1 Chr. 2:42](/1chr#1Chr.2.42)), and brother of Jerahmeel.

meshach_2092.name: Meshach
meshach_2092.bio: One of the three Hebrew youths who were trained with Daniel in Babylon ([Dan. 1:11](/dan#Dan.1.11), [19](/dan#Dan.1.19)), and promoted to the rank of Magi. He and his companions were afterwards cast into the burning fiery furnace for refusing to worship the idol the king had set up, from which they were miraculously delivered (3:13-30).

meshech_2012.name: Meshech
meshech_2012.bio: Drawing out, the sixth son of Japheth ([Gen. 10:2](/gen#Gen.10.2)), the founder of a tribe ([1 Chr. 1:5](/1chr#1Chr.1.5); [Ezek.

meshelemiah_2013.name: Meshelemiah
meshelemiah_2013.bio: Friendship of Jehovah, a Levite of the family of the Korhites, called also Shelemiah ([1 Chr. 9:21](/1chr#1Chr.9.21); [26:1](/1chr#1Chr.26.1), [2](/1chr#1Chr.26.2), [9](/1chr#1Chr.26.9), [14](/1chr#1Chr.26.14)). He was a temple gate-keeper in the time of David.

meshillemith_2017.name: Meshillemith
meshillemith_2017.bio: A priest, the son of Immer ([Neh. 11:13](/neh#Neh.11.13)).

meshullam_2020.name: Meshullam (son of Azaliah)
meshullam_2020.bio: Grandfather of Shaphan, “the scribe,” in the reign of Josiah ([2 Kings 22:3](/2kgs#2Kgs.22.3)).

meshullam_2022.name: Meshullam (Son of abihail)
meshullam_2022.bio: One of the chief Gadites in Bashan in the time of Jotham ([1 Chr. 5:13](/1chr#1Chr.5.13)).

meshullam_2027.name: Meshullam (the chief Gadites in Bashan in the time)

meshullam_2028.name: Meshullam (One of the men whom Ezra sent to Casiphi)

meshullam_2031.name: Meshullam (One of the chief Gadites in Bashan in th)

meshullam_2033.name: Meshullam (Son of Zerubbabel)
meshullam_2033.bio: One of the principal Israelites who supported Ezra when expounding the law to the people ([Neh. 8:4](/neh#Neh.8.4)).

meshullam_2037.name: Meshullam (One of the chief Gadites in Bashan in th)

meshullemeth_2040.name: Meshullemeth
meshullemeth_2040.bio: Friend, the wife of Manasseh, and the mother of Amon ([2 Kings 21:19](/2kgs#2Kgs.21.19)), Kings of Judah.

methusael_2041.name: Methusael
methusael_2041.bio: Champion of El; man of God, a descendant of Cain ([Gen. 4:18](/gen#Gen.4.18)), so called, perhaps, to denote that even among the descendants of Cain God had not left himself without a witness.

methuselah_2042.name: Methuselah
methuselah_2042.bio: Man of the dart, the son of Enoch, and grandfather of Noah. He was the oldest man of whom we have any record, dying at the age of nine hundred and sixty-nine years, in the year of the Flood ([Gen. 5:21-27](/gen#Gen.5.21); [1 Chr.

mezahab_2043.name: Mezahab
mezahab_2043.bio: Water of gold, the father of Matred ([Gen. 36:39](/gen#Gen.36.39); [1 Chr. 1:50](/1chr#1Chr.1.50)), and grandfather of Mehetabel, wife of Hadar, the last king of Edom.

mibhar_2045.name: Mibhar
mibhar_2045.bio: Choice, a Hagarene, one of David’s warriors ([1 Chr. 11:38](/1chr#1Chr.11.38)); called also Bani the Gadite ([2 Sam. 23:36](/2sam#2Sam.23.36)).

mibsam_2046.name: Mibsam (Some historians have wondered if the des)
mibsam_2046.bio: One of Ishmael’s twelve sons, and head of an Arab tribe ([Gen. 25:13](/gen#Gen.25.13)).

mibzar_2048.name: Mibzar
mibzar_2048.bio: Fortress, one of the Edomitish “dukes” descended from Esau ([Gen. 36:42](/gen#Gen.36.42); [1 Chr. 1:53](/1chr#1Chr.1.53)).

micah_2049.name: Micah (son of Jonathan)
micah_2049.bio: A man of Mount Ephraim, whose history so far is introduced in [Judg. 17](/judg#Judg.17), apparently for the purpose of leading to an account of the settlement of the tribe of Dan in Northern Palestine, and for the purpose also of illustrating the lawlessness of the times in which he lived ([Judg. 18](/judg#Judg.18); [19:1-29](/judg#Judg.19.1); [21:25](/judg#Judg.21.25)).

micah_2050.name: Micah (Re.a'iah was his son)
micah_2050.bio: A descendant of Joel the Reubenite ([1 Chr. 5:5](/1chr#1Chr.5.5)).

micah_2053.name: Micah ((Micah was a prophet from around 737 to)
micah_2053.bio: “The Morasthite,” so called to distinguish him from Micaiah, the son of Imlah ([1 Kings 22:8](/1kgs#1Kgs.22.8)). He was a prophet of Judah, a contemporary of Isaiah ([Micah 1:1](/mic#Mic.1.1)), a native of Moresheth of Gath (1:14, 15). Very little is known of the circumstances of his life (comp.

micaiah_2054.name: Micaiah
micaiah_2054.bio: Who is like Jehovah?, the son of Imlah, a faithful prophet of Samaria ([1 Kings 22:8-28](/1kgs#1Kgs.22.8)). Three years after the great battle with Ben-hadad (20:29-34), Ahab proposed to Jehoshaphat, king of Judah, that they should go up against Ramoth-Gilead to do battle again with Ben-hadad. Jehoshaphat agreed, but suggested that inquiry should be first made “at the word of Jehovah.” Ahab’s prophets approved of the expedition; but Jehoshaphat, still dissatisfied, asked if there was no other prophet besides the four hundred that had appeared, and was informed of this Micaiah.

micha_2051.name: Micha (a Levite)
micha_2051.bio: The son of Zabdi, a Levite of the family of Asaph ([Neh. 11:17](/neh#Neh.11.17), [22](/neh#Neh.11.22)).

michael_2058.name: Michael (Father of Sethur)
michael_2058.bio: The father of Sethur, the spy selected to represent Asher ([Num. 13:13](/num#Num.13.13)).

michael_2059.name: Michael (son of Jeshihai)
michael_2059.bio: A chief Gadite in Bashan ([1 Chr. 5:13](/1chr#1Chr.5.13)).

michael_2062.name: Michael (son of Izrahiah)
michael_2062.bio: [1 Chr. 7:3](/1chr#1Chr.7.3), a chief of the tribe of Issachar.

michael_2064.name: Michael (men of Manasseh)
michael_2064.bio: A Manassite, “a captain of thousands” who joined David at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:20](/1chr#1Chr.12.20)).

michael_2066.name: Michael (Jehoshaphat)
michael_2066.bio: One of the sons of king Jehoshaphat ([2 Chr. 21:2](/2chr#2Chr.21.2), [4](/2chr#2Chr.21.4)). He was murdered by his brother Jehoram.

michael_2067.name: Michael (Listed as a descendant of Shephatiah and)

michael_2068.name: Michael (princes)
michael_2068.bio: The title given to one of the chief angels ([Dan. 10:13](/dan#Dan.10.13), [21](/dan#Dan.10.21); 12:1). He had special charge of Israel as a nation.

michah_2052.name: Michah
michah_2052.bio: The first in rank of the priests of the family of Kohathites ([1 Chr. 23:20](/1chr#1Chr.23.20)).

michaiah_2057.name: Michaiah (A priest of the family of Asaph)

michaiah_2070.name: Michaiah (the Prince)
michaiah_2070.bio: One of those sent out by Jehoshaphat to instruct the people in the law ([2 Chr. 17:7](/2chr#2Chr.17.7)).

michaiah_2072.name: Michaiah (Who is like Yah?)
michaiah_2072.bio: The son of Gemariah. He reported to the king’s officers Jeremiah’s prediction, which he had heard Baruch read ([Jer. 36:11](/jer#Jer.36.11), [13](/jer#Jer.36.13)) from his father Gemariah’s chamber in the temple.

michal_2073.name: Michal
michal_2073.bio: Rivulet, or who as God?, the younger of Saul’s two daughters by his wife Ahinoam ([1 Sam. 14:49](/1sam#1Sam.14.49), [50](/1sam#1Sam.14.50)). “Attracted by the graces of his person and the gallantry of his conduct, she fell in love with David and became his wife” (18:20-28).

michri_2074.name: Michri
michri_2074.bio: Prize of Jehovah, a Benjamite, the father of Uzzi ([1 Chr. 9:8](/1chr#1Chr.9.8)).

midian_2075.name: Midian
midian_2075.bio: Strife, the fourth son of Abraham by Keturah, the father of the Midianites ([Gen. 25:2](/gen#Gen.25.2); [1 Chr. 1:32](/1chr#1Chr.1.32)).

mikloth_2079.name: Mikloth (Ruler)
mikloth_2079.bio: An officer under Dodai, in the time of David and Solomon ([1 Chr. 27:4](/1chr#1Chr.27.4)).

milalai_2081.name: Milalai
milalai_2081.bio: Eloquent, a Levitical musician ([Neh. 12:36](/neh#Neh.12.36)) who took part in the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem.

miniamin_2077.name: Miniamin (chief priest who returned from Babylon w)
miniamin_2077.bio: A chief priest who returned from Babylon with Zerubbabel ([Neh. 12:5](/neh#Neh.12.5)), called Mijamin (10:7) and Miniamin (12:17).

miriam_2087.name: Miriam (Aaron’s sister)
miriam_2087.bio: The sister of Moses and Aaron ([Ex. 2:4-10](/exod#Exod.2.4); [1 Chr. 6:3](/1chr#1Chr.6.3)).

miriam_2088.name: Miriam (The sister of Moses and Aaron ( Exodus 2)
miriam_2088.bio: [1 Chr. 4:17](/1chr#1Chr.4.17), one of the descendants of Judah.

mishael_2090.name: Mishael (son of Uzziel)
mishael_2090.bio: A Levite; the eldest of the three sons of Uzziel ([Ex. 6:22](/exod#Exod.6.22)).

mishael_2091.name: Mishael (who stood to the left of Ezra)

misham_2093.name: Misham
misham_2093.bio: Their cleansing or their beholding, a Benjamite, one of the sons of Elpaal ([1 Chr. 8:12](/1chr#1Chr.8.12)).

mishma_2094.name: Mishma (son of Mibsam)
mishma_2094.bio: One of the sons of Ishmael ([Gen. 25:14](/gen#Gen.25.14)), and founder of an Arab tribe.

mishmannah_2096.name: Mishmannah
mishmannah_2096.bio: Fatness, one of the Gadite heroes who gathered to David at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:10](/1chr#1Chr.12.10)).

mispereth_2099.name: Mispereth
mispereth_2099.bio: Number, one of the Jews who accompanied Zerubbabel from Babylon ([Ezra 2:2](/ezra#Ezra.2.2)); called also Mispereth ([Neh. 7:7](/neh#Neh.7.7)).

mizraim_2100.name: Mizraim
mizraim_2100.bio: The dual form of matzor, meaning a “mound” or “fortress,” the name of a people descended from Ham ([Gen. 10:6](/gen#Gen.10.6), [13](/gen#Gen.10.13); [1 Chr. 1:8](/1chr#1Chr.1.8), [11](/1chr#1Chr.1.11)).

mnason_2102.name: Mnason
mnason_2102.bio: reminding, or remembrancer, a Christian of Jerusalem with whom Paul lodged ( Acts 21:16 ). He was apparently a native of Cyprus, like Barnabas ( Acts 11:19 Acts 11:20 ), and was well known to the Christians of Caesarea ( 4:36 ). He was an "old disciple" (RSV, "early disciple"), i.e., he had become a Christian in the beginning of the formation of the Church in Jerusalem.

moab_2103.name: Moab
moab_2103.bio: Used to denote the people of Moab ([Num. 22:3-14](/num#Num.22.3); [Judg. 3:30](/judg#Judg.3.30); [2 Sam.

molech_2104.name: Molech
molech_2104.bio: King, the name of the national god of the Ammonites, to whom children were sacrificed by fire. He was the consuming and destroying and also at the same time the purifying fire. In [Amos 5:26](/amos#Amos.5.26), “your Moloch” of the Authorized Version is “your king” in the Revised Version (comp.

mordecai_2106.name: Mordecai (one of the leaders of those who returned)

mordecai_2107.name: Mordecai (the prophet)
mordecai_2107.bio: The son of Jair, of the tribe of Benjamin. It has been alleged that he was carried into captivity with Jeconiah, and hence that he must have been at least one hundred and twenty-nine years old in the twelfth year of Ahasuerus (Xerxes). But the words of Esther do not necessarily lead to this conclusion.

moses_2108.name: Moses
moses_2108.bio: drawn (or Egypt. mesu, "son;" hence Rameses, royal son). On the invitation of Pharaoh ( Genesis 45:17-25 ), Jacob and his sons went down into Egypt.

mother_of_the_wife_of_simon_2111.name: Mother of the Wife of Simon
mother_of_the_wife_of_simon_2111.role: Mother of the Wife of Simon

moza_2113.name: Moza (A descendant of Saul)
moza_2113.bio: One of the sons of Caleb ([1 Chr. 2:46](/1chr#1Chr.2.46)).

moza_2114.name: Moza (father of Binea)
moza_2114.bio: The son of Zimri, of the posterity of Saul ([1 Chr. 8:36](/1chr#1Chr.8.36), [37](/1chr#1Chr.8.37); [9:42](/1chr#1Chr.9.42), [43](/1chr#1Chr.9.43)).

mushi_2116.name: Mushi
mushi_2116.bio: Receding, the second of the two sons of Merari ([Ex. 6:19](/exod#Exod.6.19); [Num. 3:20](/num#Num.3.20)).
